1.verse: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who live as refugees of the dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

2.verse: elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father by being set apart by the Spirit for obedience and for sprinkling with the blood of Jesus Christ. May grace and peace be yours in ever increasing measure.

3.verse: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy gave us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

4.verse: to an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, being preserved in heaven for you,

5.verse: who by the power of God are being guarded through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

6.verse: In this you rejoice, even if now it is necessary for a short time to be made sorrowful by various trials,

7.verse: so that the genuineness of your faith (which is more precious than gold that perishes), having been tested by fire, may be found to your praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ.

8.verse: Though you have not seen him, you love him. Though not seeing him now, yet believing in him, you rejoice with joy unspeakable and filled with glory,

9.verse: because you are obtaining the goal of your faith—the salvation of your souls.

10.verse: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied of the grace that would come to you investigated diligently and examined with care,

11.verse: trying to discover what time or manner of time the Spirit of Christ who was in them was indicating when he predicted the sufferings of Christ and the glories that would follow.

12.verse: To them it was revealed that not to themselves, but to you, they were ministering these things that now have been announced to you through those who preached to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven—things into which angels long to look.

13.verse: Therefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober-minded, and set your hope completely on the grace that will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.

14.verse: As children of obedience, do not be conformed to the desires you used to have in your time of ignorance

15.verse: but, just as the one who called you is holy, so also are you to be holy in all your conduct.

16.verse: For it is written, “Be holy, because I am holy.”

17.verse: And if you call upon him as Father who judges impartially according to the work of each, conduct yourselves with fear during the time of your exile,

18.verse: since you know that you were ransomed from the empty way of life handed down from your ancestors, not by perishable things such as silver or gold,

19.verse: but by precious blood, as of a lamb without blemish or spot, the blood of Christ.

20.verse: He was chosen in advance, before the foundation of the world, but was revealed at the end of the times for you

21.verse: who through him believe in God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.

22.verse: Since you have purified your souls by obedience to the truth so that there is a sincere love for other believers, love one another fervently from a pure heart,

23.verse: for you have been born again not of perishable seed but of imperishable, by means of the living and enduring word of God.

24.verse: For “All flesh is like grass, and all its glory like the flower of grass; the grass dries up and its flower falls;

25.verse: but the word of the Lord endures for all time.” And this is the word that was preached to you.

1.verse: Therefore, having put away all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and slander of every kind,

2.verse: like newborn babes, crave the milk that is pure and spiritual, so that by it you may grow up to salvation,

3.verse: since you have tasted that the Lord is good.

4.verse: As you come to him, a living stone rejected by men but chosen by God and precious,

5.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built up as a spiritual house, to be a holy priesthood to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

6.verse: For it says in scripture, “Behold, I lay in Zion a stone, a cornerstone chosen and precious, and the one who believes in him will never be put to shame.”

7.verse: Therefore the great value is to you who believe; but for those who do not believe, “The stone that the builders rejected, this very one has become the cornerstone,”

8.verse: and, “A stone that makes people stumble and a rock that makes them fall.” They stumble, as they were destined to do, since they do not obey the word.

9.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession, so that you may declare the glorious deeds of the one who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.

10.verse: At one time you were not a people, but now you are the people of God. You were shown no mercy, but now have received mercy.

11.verse: Dear friends, I urge you as foreigners and exiles to abstain from desires of the flesh, which wage war against your soul,

12.verse: and maintain an honorable lifestyle among the Gentiles so that, with respect to the very things about which they slander you as evildoers, they may, by observing your good works, glorify God on the day of visitation.

13.verse: Submit to every human authority on account of the Lord, whether to the king as supreme,

14.verse: or to governors as those sent by him for the punishment of those who do evil and the praise of those who do good.

15.verse: For this is the will of God: by doing good to silence the ignorance of foolish men.

16.verse: Live as free people, not as those using freedom as a cover-up for evil, but as servants of God.

17.verse: Honor everyone; love the brotherhood; reverence God; honor the king.

18.verse: Household servants should be subject to their masters with all respect, not only to the good and kind but also to the unjust.

19.verse: For this is commendable, if because of conscience toward God someone endures pain while suffering unjustly.

20.verse: For what praise is there if, when you do wrong and are beaten for it, you endure it? But if when you do good and suffer for it you endure it, this is commendable in God’s sight.

21.verse: For to this you have been called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving behind for you an example so that you might follow in his footsteps.

22.verse: He did not commit sin, nor was deceit found in his mouth.

23.verse: When he was insulted, he did not respond with an insult; when he suffered, he did not threaten, but entrusted himself to the one who judges justly.

24.verse: He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree so that we, having died to sins, might live to righteousness. By his wounds you were healed.

25.verse: For you were like sheep, going astray, but now you have turned back to the shepherd and guardian of your souls.

1.verse: In the same way, wives should be subject to their own husbands, so that even if some of them refuse to believe the word, they may be won without a word by the conduct of their wives

2.verse: when they observe with respect the purity of your life.

3.verse: Do not let your beauty be external—such as braiding the hair, wearing gold jewelry, or dressing up in fine clothes—

4.verse: but let it be the inner person of the heart, the unfading beauty of a gentle and tranquil spirit, which in the sight of God is precious.

5.verse: For in the same way, at an earlier time, the devout women—those who put their hope in God—used to adorn themselves by being subject to their own husbands,

6.verse: just as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him “my lord.” You are her daughters if you do what is right and do not fear any intimidation.

7.verse: Husbands, in the same way, live with them with understanding, showing honor to the woman as a weaker vessel, since you are joint heirs of the gracious gift of life, so that your prayers may not be hindered.

8.verse: Finally, all of you, be of one mind, sympathetic, loving your believing brothers, compassionate, humble—

9.verse: not returning evil for evil or insult for insult, but on the contrary blessing, because for this you were called that you might inherit a blessing.

10.verse: For “The one who desires to love life and to see good days, let him keep his tongue from evil and his lips from speaking deceit.

11.verse: And let him turn away from evil and do good; let him seek peace and pursue it.

12.verse: For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous, and his ears are open to their prayers; but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”

13.verse: And who is the one who will harm you if you become zealots for what is good?

14.verse: But even if you should suffer because of righteousness, blessed are you. And do not fear their threats or be troubled,

15.verse: but in your hearts set apart Christ as Lord, being ready at all times to make a defense to all who ask you for a word concerning the hope that is in you.

16.verse: But do it with gentleness and respect, maintaining a clear conscience, so that in the very thing for which you are being slandered, those who are reviling your good conduct in Christ will be put to shame.

17.verse: For it is better to suffer for doing good, if it is God’s will, than for doing evil.

18.verse: Because Christ also suffered once for our sins, the righteous on behalf of the unrighteous, that he might lead you to God. He was put to death in the flesh but made alive in the spirit,

19.verse: in which also he went and proclaimed to the spirits in prison,

20.verse: who once were disobedient when the patience of God waited in the days of Noah while the ark was being built, in which a few, that is eight souls, were brought safely through water.

21.verse: This water prefigures baptism, which now saves you—not the removal of dirt from the body but the answer of a good conscience to God—by the resurrection of Jesus Christ,

22.verse: who is at the right hand of God, having gone into heaven, all angels and authorities and powers being made subject to him.

1.verse: Therefore since Christ suffered in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same way of thinking, that is, that the one who has suffered in the flesh has finished with sin,

2.verse: so that you no longer live your remaining days in the flesh concerned about human desires but about the will of God.

3.verse: For the time already gone by is enough for you to have done what the pagans like to do, carrying on in sensuality, passions, drunkenness, orgies, drinking parties, and disgusting worship of idols.

4.verse: In all this, they are surprised that you do not plunge with them into the same flood of debauchery, and they malign you.

5.verse: They will give an account to him who stands ready to judge the living and the dead.

6.verse: It was for this very purpose that the gospel was preached to the dead, so that though they were judged as men in the flesh, they might live as God in the Spirit.

7.verse: The end of all things is at hand, so use sound judgment and be sober-minded for the sake of prayer.

8.verse: Above all, maintain a fervent love among yourselves, for love covers a multitude of sins.

9.verse: Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.

10.verse: Each one should serve others in respect to the gift he has received, as a good steward of the grace of God in its various forms:

11.verse: if someone speaks, as speaking the oracles of God; if someone serves, as by the strength that God supplies—so that in everything God may be glorified through Jesus Christ. To him belong glory and power for all time. Amen.

12.verse: Dear friends, do not be surprised that a trial by fire is taking place among you, as though something strange were happening to you.

13.verse: But rejoice insofar as you now share the sufferings of Christ, so that when his glory is revealed, you may also rejoice and be glad.

14.verse: If you are insulted for the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory, that is, the Spirit of God, is resting on you.

15.verse: But not one of you should suffer as a murderer or a thief or a criminal or as a meddler in the affairs of another;

16.verse: but if someone suffers as a Christian, he should not be disgraced, but should glorify God by this name.

17.verse: Because the time has come to begin judgment with the house of God, and if first with us, what will be the outcome for those who do not obey the gospel of God?

18.verse: And “If the righteous person is barely saved, what will become of the ungodly and the sinner?”

19.verse: So then, let those who are suffering according to the will of God by doing good entrust their souls to a faithful Creator.

1.verse: Therefore I, a fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and a partaker of the glory that is about to be revealed, exhort the elders among you:

2.verse: shepherd the flock of God among you, watching over it—not because you have to, but voluntarily, as God would have it; not for shameful gain but eagerly.

3.verse: Do not domineer over those entrusted to your charge, but be examples to the flock.

4.verse: Then when the Chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the glorious crown that will not tarnish.

5.verse: Likewise, you who are younger, be subject to the elders. And all of you, clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, for “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”

6.verse: Humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God that he may exalt you in due time,

7.verse: casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares about you.

8.verse: Be sober-minded! Be alert! Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion seeking someone to devour.

9.verse: Resist him, steadfast in the faith, knowing that the same kind of sufferings are being endured by your fellow believers throughout the world.

10.verse: And the God of all grace, the one who has called you into his eternal glory in Christ, will, after you have suffered a little while, himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.

11.verse: To him be power for all time. Amen.

12.verse: By Silvanus, a faithful brother as I regard him, I have written briefly to you, exhorting and testifying that this is the true grace of God. Stand fast in it.

13.verse: She who is in Babylon, chosen along with you, sends you greetings, as does Mark, my son.

14.verse: Greet one another with the kiss of love. Peace be with all of you who are in Christ.
